Note that route maps may consist of multiple bgpRouteMapTable entries. These bgpRouteMapTable entries can be configured to match a specific address family. Any such bgpRouteMapTable entry that does not match the address family for this bgpPeergrAfiSafiTable entry is ignored. These route maps should be configured as follows. - To restrict a route map to a particular AFI/SAFI, specify bgpRouteMapMaAfi and bgpRouteMapMaSafi. - Each route map should specify an IP prefix list to match on. This is not mandated by DC-BGP, but other types of matches may have a performance impact. - Each IP prefix match is assumed to be an exact match. In other words, DC-BGP treats each bgpIpPreTable entry as having bgpIpPreLe = bgpIpPreLen, and bgpIpPreGe = 0.

bgpPeergrAfiSafiSoftResetStore.name: bgpPeergrAfiSafiSoftResetStore
bgpPeergrAfiSafiSoftResetStore.description: Gives finer control of the soft reset configuration provided by bgpPeergrSoftResetWithStoredInfo. When bgpPeergrSoftResetWithStoredInfo is 'false', BGP does not perform soft reset for any address family. When bgpPeergrSoftResetWithStoredInfo is 'true', BGP performs soft reset for those address families for which bgpPeergrAfiSafiSoftResetStore is 'true'. Any update to this object will take effect on each peer the next time that the peer session reactivates.

bgpNlriPrefixTable.name: bgpNlriPrefixTable
bgpNlriPrefixTable.description: This table contains information about paths to destination networks received from all BGP4 peers. It provides the same information as the bgpNlriTable, but is ordered by route prefix. This table must contain an identical set of fields to the bgpNlriTable. All fields must be in the same order in this table and the bgpNlriTable.

bgpNlriPrefixEntry.name: bgpNlriPrefixEntry
bgpNlriPrefixEntry.description: Information about a path to a network.

bgpNlriPrefixPeerOrAfm.name: bgpNlriPrefixPeerOrAfm
bgpNlriPrefixPeerOrAfm.description: Whether this route was learned from a BGP peer or an AFM.

bgpNlriPrefixPeerAfmIndex.name: bgpNlriPrefixPeerAfmIndex
bgpNlriPrefixPeerAfmIndex.description: The index of either the BGP peer or AFM this route was learned from. If bgpNlriPrefixPeerOrAfm is peer, this field is equivalent to a bgpPeerIndex. If bgpNlriPrefixPeerOrAfm is afm, this field is equivalent to a bgpRmAfmJoin.

bgpNlriPrefixAfi.name: bgpNlriPrefixAfi
bgpNlriPrefixAfi.description: The address family of the prefix for this NLRI.

bgpNlriPrefixSafi.name: bgpNlriPrefixSafi
bgpNlriPrefixSafi.description: The subsequent address family of the prefix for this NLRI.

bgpNlriPrefixPrfx.name: bgpNlriPrefixPrfx
bgpNlriPrefixPrfx.description: An address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. The prefix length is specified by bgpNlriPrefixPrfxLen. Any bits beyond the length specified by bgpNlriPrefixPrfxLen are zeroed. This field contains the full line format BGP NLRI omitting any NLRI length field. For SAFI 128 the NLRI includes the MPLS label and Route Distinguisher as well as the IPv4 or IPv6 address prefix.

bgpNlriPrefixPrfxLen.name: bgpNlriPrefixPrfxLen
bgpNlriPrefixPrfxLen.description: Length in bits of the IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field.

bgpNlriPrefixBest.name: bgpNlriPrefixBest
bgpNlriPrefixBest.description: An indication of whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route.

bgpNlriPrefixAsSize.name: bgpNlriPrefixAsSize
bgpNlriPrefixAsSize.description: Whether the bgpNlriPrefixASPathStr field contains two or four byte AS numbers.

bgpNlriPrefixASPathStr.name: bgpNlriPrefixASPathStr
bgpNlriPrefixASPathStr.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. If bgpRmEntAsSize is four-octet and the peer does not support four octet AS numbers this string represents the AS_PATH formed by combining the AS_PATH and AS4_PATH attributes as detailed in RFC 4893. Two-octet AS numbers appear as four-octet numbers by adding two bytes of zero padding. The format of the string is simply the AS_PATH attribute. It can be converted to a more readable format by the management agent.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigin.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigin
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigin.description: The ultimate origin of the path information.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrNextHop.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrNextHop
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrNextHop.description: The address of the border router that should be used to access the destination network. This address is the nexthop address received in the UPDATE packet. The address family of this object will be the same as that of the prefix in this row. Note that for RFC 2545 style double nexthops, this object will always contain the global scope nexthop. bgpNlriPrefixLinkLocalNextHop will contain the linklocal scope nexthop, if it is present.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrMultExtDisc.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrMultExtDisc
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrMultExtDisc.description: This metric is used to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrLocalPref.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrLocalPref
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrLocalPref.description: The originating BGP4 speaker's degree of preference for an advertised route.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAtomicAgg.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAtomicAgg
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAtomicAgg.description: When this object is set to AMB_BGP_ATOMIC_AGGR_PRESENT, the ATOMIC_AGGREGATE Path Attribute is present and indicates that the NLRI MUST NOT be made more specific.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAS.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAS
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAddr.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAddr
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAggAddr.description: The IP address of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of 0000 indicates the absence of this attribute. Note propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrCalcLclPref.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrCalcLclPref
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrCalcLclPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP4 speaker for an advertised route.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigId.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigId
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrOrigId.description: The Originator-ID identifying the router that initially advertised this destination to a Route Reflector. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates the absence of this attribute.

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrWeight.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrWeight
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrWeight.description: The local degree of preference assigned to this route.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsConfig.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsConfig
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsConfig.description: The index of the bgpFlapConfigTable containing the configuration settings being applied to this route for damping.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsPenalty.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsPenalty
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsPenalty.description: The current penalty value of this route. If it is greater than the cutoff threshold the route is suppressed.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsFlapcnt.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsFlapcnt
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsFlapcnt.description: The number of times this route has flapped since statistics were last cleared.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsSupprsd.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsSupprsd
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsSupprsd.description: Whether or not this route is suppressed.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsTimeleft.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsTimeleft
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsTimeleft.description: The time left until this route is no longer suppressed. Only valid if the route is suppressed.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsCleardamp.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsCleardamp
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsCleardamp.description: This field is present to ensure that fields in the bgpNlriPrefixTable correspond to fields in the bgpNlriTable. It has no meaning when read.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsClearstat.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsClearstat
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStatsClearstat.description: This field is present to ensure that fields in the bgpNlriPrefixTable correspond to fields in the bgpNlriTable. It has no meaning when read.

bgpNlriPrefixEcmp.name: bgpNlriPrefixEcmp
bgpNlriPrefixEcmp.description: Whether or not this route was installed into the Forwarding Table as an ECMP route (it may or may not be the best BGP4 route advertised to BGP peers).

bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAsPathLimAs.name: bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAsPathLimAs
bgpNlriPrefixPathAttrAsPathLimAs.description: The AS number of the speaker that attached the AS_PATHLIMIT attribute. A value of 0 indicates the absence of this attribute. Note that propagation of AS of zero is illegal in the Internet.

bgpNlriPrefixPthAttAsPthLimUpper.name: bgpNlriPrefixPthAttAsPthLimUpper
bgpNlriPrefixPthAttAsPthLimUpper.description: The upper bound on the number of ASes in the AS_PATH associated with this route before the route will be filtered. Only valid if bgpPathAttrAsPathLimAs is non-zero.

bgpNlriPrefixIsActive.name: bgpNlriPrefixIsActive
bgpNlriPrefixIsActive.description: An indication of whether or not this route is installed in the forwarding table. If bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive is set to 'false', then this is set to - 'active' if the route is installed in the forwarding table, or is a route redistributed from another routing protocol instance - 'inactive' otherwise. If bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive is set to 'true', BGP does not track active routes. In this case, bgpNlriIsActive is set to 'notTracked'.

bgpNlriPrefixUserData.name: bgpNlriPrefixUserData
bgpNlriPrefixUserData.description: User data for this BGP NLRI prefix entry.

bgpNlriPrefixStale.name: bgpNlriPrefixStale
bgpNlriPrefixStale.description: Whether or not this route was last sent by the peer before BGP detected that the peer was restarting. If the route is not re-advertised by the peer before the restart completes, BGP will remove the route from its database. This flag is set to 'false' if the peer is not restarting, or if the route has been advertised by the peer since the restart.

bgpNlriPrefixFlapStartTime.name: bgpNlriPrefixFlapStartTime
bgpNlriPrefixFlapStartTime.description: The value of sysUpTime when this route flapped. If RIB Manager is not tracking a penalty for this route, this field is set to zero.

bgpNlriPrefixLinkLocalNextHop.name: bgpNlriPrefixLinkLocalNextHop
bgpNlriPrefixLinkLocalNextHop.description: The IPv6 link-local address of the border router that should be used to access the destination network. This object is only valid for a prefix with a received RFC 2545 style double nexthop.

bgpRmAfmJoinTable.name: bgpRmAfmJoinTable
bgpRmAfmJoinTable.description: Each entry in this table represents a join to an AFM for which a RIB Manager entity is master.

bgpRmAfmJoinEntry.name: bgpRmAfmJoinEntry
bgpRmAfmJoinEntry.description: Each entry represents a join to an AFM for which a RIB Manager entity is master.

bgpRmAfmJoin.name: bgpRmAfmJoin
bgpRmAfmJoin.description: Identifies a join for which a RIB Manager entity is master.

bgpRmAfmRowStatus.name: bgpRmAfmRowStatus
bgpRmAfmRowStatus.description: The row status for this table entry, used to create and destroy table entries.

bgpRmAfmAdminStatus.name: bgpRmAfmAdminStatus
bgpRmAfmAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this table entry, used to activate and deactivate the join.

bgpRmAfmOperStatus.name: bgpRmAfmOperStatus
bgpRmAfmOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this join.

bgpRmAfmPartnerIndex.name: bgpRmAfmPartnerIndex
bgpRmAfmPartnerIndex.description: Index that identifies the slave entity for this join.

bgpRmAfmAfi.name: bgpRmAfmAfi
bgpRmAfmAfi.description: Address Family Identifier for this join. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpRmAfmSafi.name: bgpRmAfmSafi
bgpRmAfmSafi.description: Subsequent Address Family Identifier for this join. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpRmAfmJoinStatus.name: bgpRmAfmJoinStatus
bgpRmAfmJoinStatus.description: The status of the master join.

bgpRmAfmRestartTime.name: bgpRmAfmRestartTime
bgpRmAfmRestartTime.description: This is the maximum time that DC-BGP will retain routes from this AFM following failure of this join. DC-BGP will delete all retained stale routes from this AFM once this time has passed. A value of 0 indicates that routes from this AFM will be discarded as soon as the join fails.

bgpRmNmTable.name: bgpRmNmTable
bgpRmNmTable.description: This table contains information on slave joins to Neighbor Manager entities. Each row in this table represents one slave join in a particular RIB Manager entity.

bgpRmNmEntry.name: bgpRmNmEntry
bgpRmNmEntry.description: Represents a join to a Neighbor Manager for which the RIB Manager is slave.

bgpRmNmMasterIndex.name: bgpRmNmMasterIndex
bgpRmNmMasterIndex.description: Index of the master entity. This is the index received in the join registration info sent from the master to the slave on the join registration IPS.

bgpRmNmJoinStatus.name: bgpRmNmJoinStatus
bgpRmNmJoinStatus.description: The status of the slave join.

bgpNmMjTable.name: bgpNmMjTable
bgpNmMjTable.description: Each entry in this table represents a join for which a Neighbor Manager entity is master. This table always contains exactly three rows, one each for the joins from NM to RM, the IP Sockets Stub and the BFD stub. If NM is configured not to join to the BFD stub (bgpNmEntBfdEntityIndex is zero), then the row for the BFD join is still present, with bgpNmMjJoinStatus set to mjNotJoined.

bgpNmMjEntry.name: bgpNmMjEntry
bgpNmMjEntry.description: Each entry represents a join for which a Neighbor Manager entity is master.

bgpNmMjJoin.name: bgpNmMjJoin
bgpNmMjJoin.description: Identifies a join for which a Neighbor Manager entity is master.

bgpNmMjJoinPartner.name: bgpNmMjJoinPartner
bgpNmMjJoinPartner.description: Identifies the type of process acting as slave on this join.

bgpNmMjPartnerIndex.name: bgpNmMjPartnerIndex
bgpNmMjPartnerIndex.description: The index assigned to this join by NM. This index is used by FTI-specific handling code within System Manager to identify the entity index of a slave entity suitable to act as join partner.

bgpNmMjJoinStatus.name: bgpNmMjJoinStatus
bgpNmMjJoinStatus.description: The status of the master join.

bgpRmArinhJoinTable.name: bgpRmArinhJoinTable
bgpRmArinhJoinTable.description: This read-only table contains information on Active Route Interface slave joins used for querying next hops. Each row in this table represents one slave join in a particular RIB Manager entity.

bgpRmArinhJoinEntry.name: bgpRmArinhJoinEntry
bgpRmArinhJoinEntry.description: Represents an ARI join for which the RIB Manager is slave.

bgpRmArinhAfi.name: bgpRmArinhAfi
bgpRmArinhAfi.description: Specifies the address family identifier with which this ARI join is associated.

bgpRmArinhSafi.name: bgpRmArinhSafi
bgpRmArinhSafi.description: Specifies the subsequent address family identifier with which this ARI join is associated.

bgpRmArinhJoinStatus.name: bgpRmArinhJoinStatus
bgpRmArinhJoinStatus.description: The status of the ARI slave join for querying next hops.

bgpNmEntTable.name: bgpNmEntTable
bgpNmEntTable.description: Each entry in this table represents a Neighbor Manager entity. Fields in an entry cannot be changed while the admin status is up.

bgpNmEntEntry.name: bgpNmEntEntry
bgpNmEntEntry.description: Each entry represents a Neighbor Manager entity.

bgpNmEntIndex.name: bgpNmEntIndex
bgpNmEntIndex.description: Identifies the Neighbor Manager entity which should handle this listen socket.

bgpNmEntRowStatus.name: bgpNmEntRowStatus
bgpNmEntRowStatus.description: The row status for this Neighbor Manager Entity Table entry, used to create and destroy table entries.

bgpNmEntAdminStatus.name: bgpNmEntAdminStatus
bgpNmEntAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this Neighbor Manager entity, used to activate and deactivate NM.

bgpNmEntOperStatus.name: bgpNmEntOperStatus
bgpNmEntOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this Neighbor Manager entity.

bgpNmEntRmIndex.name: bgpNmEntRmIndex
bgpNmEntRmIndex.description: Identifies a RIB Manager entity to which the Neighbor Manager will join. This index is mapped to an RM entity index by FTI-Specific Handling code within System Manager. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpNmEntSckIndex.name: bgpNmEntSckIndex
bgpNmEntSckIndex.description: Identifies the SCK stub entity to join with. This index is used in the join user data, to enable FTI-specific code within System Manager to select a suitable slave SCK stub entity. The status of the join is given by the row in the bgpNmMjTable with bgpNmMjJoinPartner equal to bgpComponentIpSockets. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpNmEntBfdEntityIndex.name: bgpNmEntBfdEntityIndex
bgpNmEntBfdEntityIndex.description: Identifies a BFD stub entity to which the Neighbor Manager will join. A value of zero indicates that no BFD provider is available, or that NM should not join to any BFD provider. If a BFD join is requested (bfdNmEntBfdEntityIndex is set to a non-zero value), but the BFD join fails to activate, then NM will also fail to activate. This field can only be changed when the NM entity admin status is down.

bgpNmListenTable.name: bgpNmListenTable
bgpNmListenTable.description: Each entry in this table represents a listen socket in the Neighbor Manager entity.

bgpNmListenEntry.name: bgpNmListenEntry
bgpNmListenEntry.description: Each entry represents a listen socket.

bgpNmListenIndex.name: bgpNmListenIndex
bgpNmListenIndex.description: Identifies this listen socket since each NM instance can have more than one Listen socket configured.

bgpNmListenRowStatus.name: bgpNmListenRowStatus
bgpNmListenRowStatus.description: The row status for this Neighbor Manager Listen Table entry, used to create and destroy table entries.

bgpNmListenAdminStatus.name: bgpNmListenAdminStatus
bgpNmListenAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this Listen entry, used to activate and deactivate the Listen socket.

bgpNmListenOperStatus.name: bgpNmListenOperStatus
bgpNmListenOperStatus.description: The current operational status of this Listen socket.

bgpNmListenAddrType.name: bgpNmListenAddrType
bgpNmListenAddrType.description: The address family of the address used to listen on. This determines the format of the bgpNmListenAddr field. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down. Valid values are: AMB_INETWK_ADDR_TYPE_IPV4 and AMB_INETWK_ADDR_TYPE_IPV6.

bgpNmListenAddr.name: bgpNmListenAddr
bgpNmListenAddr.description: The address used to listen on. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down. If set to a zero length address DC-BGP will listen on all addresses available to this NM instance. For a specific port you cannot listen on a specific address if you are already listening on all addresses. Similarly, for a specific port you cannot listen on all addresses if you are already listening on a specific address.

bgpNmListenPort.name: bgpNmListenPort
bgpNmListenPort.description: The port used to listen on. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpNmListenAcceptAll.name: bgpNmListenAcceptAll
bgpNmListenAcceptAll.description: This is set to TRUE if this socket will accept incoming connections from any peer. The recommended value is FALSE. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpNmListenAddrScopeId.name: bgpNmListenAddrScopeId
bgpNmListenAddrScopeId.description: The scope ID of the bgpNmListenAddr. The scope ID is required if the address is an IPv6 link-local address. Otherwise, this field must be set to zero. This field can only be changed when the Admin Status is down.

bgpRmAfiSafiTable.name: bgpRmAfiSafiTable
bgpRmAfiSafiTable.description: Table of per-<AFI, SAFI> configuration information.

bgpRmAfiSafiEntry.name: bgpRmAfiSafiEntry
bgpRmAfiSafiEntry.description: Entry containing information about support for an <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiAfi.name: bgpRmAfiSafiAfi
bgpRmAfiSafiAfi.description: The AFI index into the <AFI, SAFI> table.

bgpRmAfiSafiSafi.name: bgpRmAfiSafiSafi
bgpRmAfiSafiSafi.description: The SAFI index into the <AFI, SAFI> table.

bgpRmAfiSafiAdminStatus.name: bgpRmAfiSafiAdminStatus
bgpRmAfiSafiAdminStatus.description: The administrative status for this <AFI,SAFI>. The IPv4 Unicast address family is always active (and therefore admin-up). The default for other address families is to be admin-down. This field can only be set while RM is admin down, and may only be moved to down if there are no route maps or aggregate addresses defined for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiStateKept.name: bgpRmAfiSafiStateKept
bgpRmAfiSafiStateKept.description: This value is used only if Graceful Restart procedures are supported (in other words if bgpRmEntRestartSupported is true). If set to true, then the Restart Capability generated after a local restart will indicate that forwarding state has been maintained for this address family over the restart. If set to false, then the forwarding state flag in the Restart Capability for this address family will be set to indicate that forwarding state has not been maintained. This field can only be set while RM is admin down.

bgpRmAfiSafiAfmRequired.name: bgpRmAfiSafiAfmRequired
bgpRmAfiSafiAfmRequired.description: If this flag is set, DC-BGP will require an active AFM join to be present before advertising NLRI of this <AFI, SAFI> to peers. This ensures that routes are not advertised to peers that are not known to the local forwarding table.

bgpRmAfiSafiLocRibBlocked.name: bgpRmAfiSafiLocRibBlocked
bgpRmAfiSafiLocRibBlocked.description: This flag is set if the Loc-RIB for this <AFI, SAFI> is currently blocked, in which case DC-BGP will not advertise any routes of this <AFI, SAFI> to peers. A Loc-RIB is blocked either because RM is undergoing graceful restart, or because bgpRmAfiSafiAfmRequired is set to AMB_TRUE and there are no active AFM joins for this <AFI, SAFI>. A Loc-RIB is unblocked when graceful restart completes, or when an AFM join becomes active. This flag is only valid If both RM and this <AFI, SAFI> are active.

bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive.name: bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive
bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive.description: If set to 'true', the best route will be advertised to peers, whether or not the route has been added to the forwarding table by the AFM. If set to 'false', then BGP will only advertise a route to peers if the route has been installed in the forwarding table, or if the route has been redistributed by the AFM from another routing protocol instance. It is the responsibility of the AFM to determine whether to only redistribute active routes to BGP. This option requires an AFM to be present, and so bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive may only be set to 'false' if bgpRmAfiSafiAfmRequired is set to 'true'. In addition, this option requires that an AFM be configured to inform BGP whenever a route from BGP is successfully installed in the forwarding table, or is removed from the forwarding table. This is achieved by configuring an AFM to redistribute routes from this instance of BGP back to this instance of BGP. Not all AFMs support this redistribution of routes. For such address families, an attempt to set bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive to 'false' will be rejected. This field can only be modified while RM is admin down.

bgpRmAfiSafiUserData.name: bgpRmAfiSafiUserData
bgpRmAfiSafiUserData.description: User data for this BGP AFI SAFI entry.

bgpRmAfiSafiIbgpPrefixes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiIbgpPrefixes
bgpRmAfiSafiIbgpPrefixes.description: The total number of iBGP routes received for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiEbgpPrefixes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiEbgpPrefixes
bgpRmAfiSafiEbgpPrefixes.description: The total number of eBGP routes received for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiRedistPrefixes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiRedistPrefixes
bgpRmAfiSafiRedistPrefixes.description: The total number of routes redistributed for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxes
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxes.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are stored in an Adj-RIB-In.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesAccepted.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesAccepted
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesAccepted.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in an Adj-RIB-In and are eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesRejected.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesRejected
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesRejected.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in an Adj-RIB-In and are NOT eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxes
bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxes.description: The number of prefixes for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in an Adj-RIB-Out. Note that this value is affected by the bgpRmEntNonPersistentAros field since, if that field is set to TRUE, routes are removed from the Adj-RIB-Out to reduce occupancy.

bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxesAdvertised.name: bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxesAdvertised
bgpRmAfiSafiOutPrfxesAdvertised.description: The number of advertised prefixes for this <AFI, SAFI> currently associated with any peer. This field is not affected by the bgpRmEntNonPersistentAros field. Note that even if bgpRmEntNonPersistentAros is FALSE the value of this field may differ from bgpPrfxOutPrfxes since that field includes recently withdrawn routes which are undergoing suppression procedures.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesActive.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesActive
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesActive.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in the Adj-RIB-In and are active in the Loc-Rib. This field is set to zero if bgpRmAfiSafiAdvertiseInactive is set to 'true'.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapped.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapped
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapped.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in the Adj-RIB-In and for which RIB Manager is tracking a route flap damping penalty.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapSuppr.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapSuppr
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapSuppr.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are installed in the Adj-RIB-In and that are suppressed as a result of route flapping.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapHistory.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapHistory
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesFlapHistory.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are not currently in the Adj-RIB-In, but which have an associated route flap damping penalty.

bgpRmAfiSafiDefaultImportRule.name: bgpRmAfiSafiDefaultImportRule
bgpRmAfiSafiDefaultImportRule.description: The default behavior that BGP applies when it receives a route of this address family for which an import policy has not been configured.

bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesDeniedByPol.name: bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesDeniedByPol
bgpRmAfiSafiInPrfxesDeniedByPol.description: The number of prefixes received for this <AFI, SAFI> that are stored, but failed import policy and so have not been installed in the Adj-RIB-In. Note that this count only applies to denied prefixes from peers for which 'soft reset with stored routing information' is enabled for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiNumLocRibRoutes.name: bgpRmAfiSafiNumLocRibRoutes
bgpRmAfiSafiNumLocRibRoutes.description: The number of routes installed in the Loc-RIB for this <AFI, SAFI>.

bgpRmAfiSafiNextHopSafi.name: bgpRmAfiSafiNextHopSafi
bgpRmAfiSafiNextHopSafi.description: Specifies the SAFI that will be used to resolve BGP next hops for routes with this <AFI, SAFI>. This may be set to none, unicast or multicast. If set to none, BGP next hops are resolved using the AFI/SAFI of the BGP next hop, subject to the QBDC_USER_EXTRACT_BGP_NEXT_HOP user exit. This field can only be modified while RM is admin down.

bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrType.name: bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrType
bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrType.description: Version of bgpPeerLocalAddrType used for notifications.

bgpNotifPeerLocalAddr.name: bgpNotifPeerLocalAddr
bgpNotifPeerLocalAddr.description: Version of bgpPeerLocalAddr used for notifications.

bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddrType.name: bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddrType
bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddrType.description: Version of bgpPeerRemoteAddrType used for notifications.

bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddr.name: bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddr
bgpNotifPeerRemoteAddr.description: Version of bgpPeerRemoteAddr used for notifications.

bgpNotifRmEntIndex.name: bgpNotifRmEntIndex
bgpNotifRmEntIndex.description: Version of bgpRmEntIndex used for notifications.

bgpNotifPeerLocalPort.name: bgpNotifPeerLocalPort
bgpNotifPeerLocalPort.description: Version of bgpPeerLocalPort used for notifications.

bgpNotifPeerRemotePort.name: bgpNotifPeerRemotePort
bgpNotifPeerRemotePort.description: Version of bgpPeerRemotePort used for notifications.

bgpPeerLastFailureCause.name: bgpPeerLastFailureCause
bgpPeerLastFailureCause.description: The cause of a Backwards Transition trap. If this is not a Backwards Transition trap this is set to zero.

bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrScopeId.name: bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrScopeId
bgpNotifPeerLocalAddrScopeId.description: Version of bgpPeerLocalAddrScopeId used for notifications.

bgpTrapData.name: bgpTrapData
bgpTrapData.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap in the following circumstances: - When a BGP peer's FSM enters the established state, if bgpPeerTrapEstab is set to 'true' for the peer - When a BGP peer's FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state, if bgpPeerTrapBackw is set to 'true' for the peer - When the local device changes Graceful Restart helper state for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapGrHelperState is set to 'true' for the peer - When the maximum numbers of prefixes is reached for an AFI/SAFI for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the peer and bgpPeerAfiSafiTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the AFI/SAFI - When the prefix threshold is breached for an AFI/SAFI for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the peer and bgpPeerAfiSafiTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the AFI/SAFI.

bgpEntTrapData.name: bgpEntTrapData
bgpEntTrapData.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. If bgpRmEntTrapOperState is set to 'true', DC-BGP will send a trap when the local device enters RM operational state 'up', 'down' or 'actFailed'.

bgpPeerSessionEstablished.name: bgpPeerSessionEstablished
bgpPeerSessionEstablished.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap when a BGP peer's FSM enters the established state, if bgpPeerTrapEstab is set to 'true' for the peer.

bgpPeerSessionBackward.name: bgpPeerSessionBackward
bgpPeerSessionBackward.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap when a BGP peer's FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state, if bgpPeerTrapBackw is set to 'true' for the peer.

bgpPeerAfiSafiMaxPrefix.name: bgpPeerAfiSafiMaxPrefix
bgpPeerAfiSafiMaxPrefix.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap when the maximum numbers of prefixes is reached for an AFI/SAFI for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the peer and bgpPeerAfiSafiTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the AFI/SAFI.

bgpPeerAfiSafiPrefixThreshold.name: bgpPeerAfiSafiPrefixThreshold
bgpPeerAfiSafiPrefixThreshold.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap when the prefix threshold is breached for an AFI/SAFI for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the peer and bgpPeerAfiSafiTrapPrefix is set to 'true' for the AFI/SAFI.

bgpEntOperStatusChange.name: bgpEntOperStatusChange
bgpEntOperStatusChange.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. If bgpRmEntTrapOperState is set to 'true', DC-BGP will send a trap when the local device enters RM operational state 'up', 'down' or 'actFailed'.

bgpEntRestartHelperChange.name: bgpEntRestartHelperChange
bgpEntRestartHelperChange.description: Structure used to send trap data to the MIB Manager. DC-BGP will send a trap when the local device changes Graceful Restart helper state for a peer, if bgpPeerTrapGrHelperState is set to 'true' for the peer.

bgpCompliance.name: bgpCompliance
bgpCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the DC-BGP mib.

bgpRmEntityGroup.name: bgpRmEntityGroup
bgpRmEntityGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the RIB Manager Entity table.

bgpRmAfmJoinGroup.name: bgpRmAfmJoinGroup
bgpRmAfmJoinGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the RM AFM Join table.

bgpRmNmGroup.name: bgpRmNmGroup
bgpRmNmGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the RM NM Join table.

bgpNmMjGroup.name: bgpNmMjGroup
bgpNmMjGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the NM Master Join table.

bgpNmEntGroup.name: bgpNmEntGroup
bgpNmEntGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Neighbor Manager Entity table.

bgpNmListenGroup.name: bgpNmListenGroup
bgpNmListenGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Neighbor Manager Listen table.

bgpPeerGroup.name: bgpPeerGroup
bgpPeerGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Peer tables.

bgpPathAttributesGroup.name: bgpPathAttributesGroup
bgpPathAttributesGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Nlri tables.

bgpPolicyGroup.name: bgpPolicyGroup
bgpPolicyGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Policy tables.

bgpRmEntityOptionalGroup.name: bgpRmEntityOptionalGroup
bgpRmEntityOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the RIB Manager Entity table.

bgpRmAfmJoinOptionalGroup.name: bgpRmAfmJoinOptionalGroup
bgpRmAfmJoinOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the AFM table.

bgpNmListenOptionalGroup.name: bgpNmListenOptionalGroup
bgpNmListenOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the Listen table.

bgpPeerOptionalGroup.name: bgpPeerOptionalGroup
bgpPeerOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the Peer table.

bgpPathAttributesOptionalGroup.name: bgpPathAttributesOptionalGroup
bgpPathAttributesOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the path attributes tables.

bgpPolicyOptionalGroup.name: bgpPolicyOptionalGroup
bgpPolicyOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the policy tables.

bgpNotificationsGroup.name: bgpNotificationsGroup
bgpNotificationsGroup.description: The notifications group is completely optional.

bgpRmAfiSafiGroup.name: bgpRmAfiSafiGroup
bgpRmAfiSafiGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the AFI SAFI tables.

bgpRmAfiSafiOptionalGroup.name: bgpRmAfiSafiOptionalGroup
bgpRmAfiSafiOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the AFI SAFI table.

bgpAdjRibOutGroup.name: bgpAdjRibOutGroup
bgpAdjRibOutGroup.description: This group contains objects that are read-only, and is completely optional.

bgpOrfCapabilityGroup.name: bgpOrfCapabilityGroup
bgpOrfCapabilityGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the ORF Capability table.

bgpOrfCapabilityOptionalGroup.name: bgpOrfCapabilityOptionalGroup
bgpOrfCapabilityOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the ORF Capability table.

bgpPeerAfiSafiOptionalGroup.name: bgpPeerAfiSafiOptionalGroup
bgpPeerAfiSafiOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the peer AFI/SAFI table.

bgpPeergrAfiSafiOptionalGroup.name: bgpPeergrAfiSafiOptionalGroup
bgpPeergrAfiSafiOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the peer group AFI/SAFI table.

bgpPeerOrfCapabilityGroup.name: bgpPeerOrfCapabilityGroup
bgpPeerOrfCapabilityGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the Peer ORF Capability table.

bgpPeerOrfCapabilityOptionalGrp.name: bgpPeerOrfCapabilityOptionalGrp
bgpPeerOrfCapabilityOptionalGrp.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the Peer ORF Capability table.

bgpRmArinhJoinGroup.name: bgpRmArinhJoinGroup
bgpRmArinhJoinGroup.description: This group is mandatory for all agent implementations. It contains mandatory, non-defaultable or read-only objects in the RM ARI Join table.

bgpNmEntOptionalGroup.description: This group contains objects that are defaultable and can optionally be configured in the Neighbor Manager Entity table.
